ISSUE.TITLE: [Bug] Condition for webhook automation does not take boolean type into consideration
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: NocoDB used as docker : **false** NocoDB version : **"nocodb": "^0.84.6"** Database used in NC_DB URL : **pg** Project was created by clicking : **New Project by connecting to external database** Database on which spreadsheet is created : **pg** OS on which NocoDB is running : **Ubuntu 18.04.6 LTS** Node.js version if running as node : **v15.3.0** Database version : **Postgres 12.9** **Steps To Reproduce** 1. Install Slack App 1. Create webhook automation for Slack app that happens after an update 1. Add a condition for when the update happens 1. Condition needs to be related to a column like a checkbox or another column that implements a boolean type (TRUE/FALSE) 1. Example condition would be: `where, column_name, is equal, true` **Notes** 1. An example JSON that is sent back to the BE is: ```"[{\"field\":\"Validated\",\"op\":\"is equal\",\"value\":\"true\",\"logicOp\":\"and\"}]")```. 1. Even after the values are parsed, with JSON.parse, the value remains a string: ``` [ { "field": "Validated", "op": "is equal", "value": "true", "logicOp": "and" } ] ``` 1. The check I believe happens here: https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/blob/1cbaaab6bf838aa8c38a35f3fab06670ca8d9264/packages/nocodb/src/lib/noco/common/BaseModel.ts#L397. `data[field]` is probably `TRUE` while `con.value` is `"true"`. These would never equate unless the value itself is parsed further to see if it can be converted into a boolean value. The suggested change would probably be to just do: `JSON.parse(con.value)`. **Expected behavior** When the condition is met, such as when a column is true and the condition put in is `"true"`, then the webhook should be sent out afterward. I believe this is not happening because the values are not parsed from the JS side, I believe they are all literal strings instead of appropriate values.
